result.execSummary:
The deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Steven Scott Kaminski in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Claire G Roehre appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 21.  Review hearing scheduled for March 4, 2019 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Steven Scott Kaminski in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for DPA hearing. Defense requests an adjourned date. State has no objection. Court grants adjournment. Case remains calendared in Branch 40.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for January 15, 2019 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Steven Scott Kaminski in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status conference. Defense counsel requests more time to review for possible deferred prosecution agreement.   Court ordered case adjourned for deferred prosecution agreement hearing in Branch 40.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for December 19, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Steven Scott Kaminski in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense requests a status conference date. Case remains calendared in Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for November 13, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Steven Scott Kaminski in court.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for status of counsel. Statements by defendant that the attorney he wants to retain hasn't returned his calls.  Defendant wishes to have counsel appointed by the court. Court conducted Indigency Hearing. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. Court held colloquy with defendant. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed attorney Michael Plaisted, present in court via telephone, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $70.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $100.000.00 per month with the first payment due 11-01-2018, and then the 1st of each month thereafter. Case is adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for October 11, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Steven Scott Kaminski in court.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for status of counsel. Defendant still needs additional time to retain attorney Verhulst. Court orders case adjourned for status of counsel, Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for September 21, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Steven Scott Kaminski in court.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant appears without counsel. Defendant advised to contact attorney Verhulst. Court orders case adjourned for status of counsel to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Steven Scott Kaminski in court with attorney Benjamin Verhulst as a friend of the court.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant requests additional time to retain attorney Verhulst. State has no objection. Court orders case adjourned for status of counsel and pretrial conference. Case remains scheduled in Branch 40.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 6, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Steven Scott Kaminski in court.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM  
Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests more time to retain counsel.   All parties are advised effective August 4, 2018 case will be reassigned to Branch 40, Reserve Judge in Room 515 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for August 17, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Steven Scott Kaminski in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Defendant Steven Scott Kaminski in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7.    DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 20, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal appeared earlier in court.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Steven Scott Kaminski in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Steven Scott Kaminski in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 45.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Steven Scott Kaminski not in court.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
